reference.unstructured: Translation of the original title in Italian language was done by Fr George Aquilina
An Assessment and technical description of the book-binding was provided by Mr Joseph Schiro, Book Conservator at the National Library in Valletta

There is a mention in the British Standard 5454 published 1977 on precautions necessary to protect the seals while in storage; however no indication or specification is given on how to store the documents with pendant seals. Pads of cotton wool encased in polyethylene foil which were recommended at that time, in fact absorb oils from wax, the main component of seals, which results in overdrying of the seals and leads to their gradual, structural destruction

title: Origins of mtDNA mutations in ageing

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
<jats:p>The aim of the study is to determine the intensity of exercise during amateur running competitions taking place in the Sudeten Mountains, based on results of measurements of energy expenditure. The study covered those participating in 2015-17 and included details on themselves and their preparation. Their energy consumption was measured using a CALTRAC<jats:sup>TM</jats:sup> device. Routes are described by distance (km) and altitude (m). Average energy output values for 19.2 km and 613.8 m were calculated from measurements taken which was characterized as ‘unduly heavy’. In women this value was 11.6 kcal/1 min/55 kg and in men - 12.7 kcal/1 min/65 kg.</jats:p>
title: Assessment of Exercise Intensity During Amateur Running Competitions in the Sudety Mountains
